docs.title: Possible new colonies
docs.text:
Leptothorax acervorum - or another colony of ants that are passive to other colonies

Messor aciculatus - No hibernation but rather small

Messor minor hesperius - no hibernation (ish)

docs.title: Water
docs.text:
Ants need water all the time. There was some debate by byFormica if ants can locate water in liquid feeders without assistance. They suggest adding a few drops of sunburst product to all water to aid discovery. The community however does not suggest this is necessary.

Ref: https://byformica.com/pages/faq #BEST PRACTICES FOR USING SUNBURST ANT NECTAR

docs.title: Sugar
docs.text:
All ants except Messor require sugar and Messor can be given the option.

The "norm" is to use a sugar formula such as "byformica sunburst ant nectar", things to look out for are;

  • How long the product lasts once opened
  • Duration it can be in a liquid feeder
    • Some can be in liquid feeders for 10+days
  • Does it need to be refrigerated
  • Does it need diluting before use

docs.title: Protein
docs.text:
All ants except Messor require protein and Messor can be given the option apparently can be hit and miss.

There are several options to provide protein from live insects to pastes.

BestAntsUK protein Jelly

docs.title: Suppliers
docs.text: I keep forgetting where to buy ants and setup from, so creating this jot list.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Comes in a small tube and easy to squirt out the right amount. All my colonies appear to be interested in it and it's storage and life is excellent for the busy ant keeper.

Overall I'll be keeping a supply at hand.

docs.title: Storage + life
docs.text:
• Can leave in **outworld for 2-3 day**s

  • BestAntsUK advises it to be stored at all times in the fridge.

  • Once opened use within a month.

  • Unopened product lasts six months.

docs.title: Pro/Cons
docs.text: Sources suggest dead wax worms smell terrible. Live apparently are odorless It is also advised the medium used can be smelly
